reviews.review_msg: Exam materials are way off the actual content that are described in the lectures. He doesn't bother rethinking new content for the course (homework, quizzes, etc.) and therefore reuses his old quizzes and homework for the tests. He doesn't even post the answer to the homework (he does describe them during the office hour though).
Worst class experience of my life. Unless you consider yourself a genius level student, or don't care about your GPA at all, avoid his class at all cost!
He tries to cover everything in the book, but you have to do all the real work. He does his job and does not care if everybody fails or everybody passes with A(Not Likely at all!). Nice guy.
Very bad teaching skills. Kind of hard to understand what he is saying. Teaching an important course at too early in the morning.

The most useless course I've ever taken in my academic life. I could barely understand anything he said in class. His lecture materials are harder to understand than the textbook. I had to download materials from other schools to understand concepts. What is most annoying about the course is that asides from the horrible grade, I learned NOTHING.

He is the worst lecturer ever in SFU. I will suggest no one to take course with him. The quality is zero, you wont understand a word in class due to language barrier and the exam is extremely irrelevant and super hard to be done in time. He is also very tough on grade.
Very boring algorithm class. He didn't bother even talking a little bit louder so that the second row students could have hear him. Very unfair exam and horrible final grades.

apparently algorithm analysis and design equals proofs and graph theory, looking for a use for graph theory?, i mean really has anyone actually really used it in anything other than academics lately, lol

Lecture notes self-contained, concepts clearly explained. Textbook reading is helpful but not required. Prof. Chindelevitch is approachable and helpful answering any questions. If one has a strong math background, this course is not that difficult. Highly recommend - gives a foundation towards computational complexity. Fair exams, HW can be long.
You REALLY need to pay attention during the all the lectures !!! The stuff is difficult and challenging, but you DEFINITELY can learn a lot.
Certainly you can learn a lot from this course. Beware of the difficulty.
Best SFU computer science professor for sure. Recommend it so much.
